questions.question_text: When a user clicks on the Communicate workaround UI action on the Problem form, what happens?

choices.D: Workaround is written to the Work notes field on any open Incident associated with the problem
choices.C: Workaround is written to a draft Knowledge article
choices.B: Workaround is written to the Workaround field on any incident associated with the problem
choices.A: Workaround is written to the Comments field on any open Incident associated with the problem

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
To comments it is copied when an incident is resolved, therefore not active, thus A cannot be correct. The only correct is D.

Selected Answer: D
D is correct

Selected Answer: D
Answer is D.

Selected Answer: D
I tested this on PDI (Washington DC).

We have the following script actions:
1) Script Actions "Copy Prb workaround to Inc comments"
Tiggered by event: communicate.workaround
Action: It copies the Workaround to Additional Comments of all related incident records with State = Resolved & Resolution Code = Known Error.

2) Script Actions "Copy Prb workaround to Inc work notes"
Tiggered by event: communicate.workaround
Action: It copies the Workaround to Work Notes of all related incident records with State = New, In Progress & On Hold.

3) Script Actions "Copy Prb fix to Inc work notes"
Tiggered by event: communicate.workaround
Action: It copies the Fix to Work Notes of all related incident records with State = New, In Progress & On Hold.

Selected Answer: D
Workaround is copied to Work notes for all incidents where State= New, In Progress, OR On Hold

Selected Answer: D
D, for comments, inc must be resolved and resolution code = known error

Selected Answer: D
The comments are only added to resolved incidents with a resolution code of Known Issue, therefore A is incorrect.

D is the correct answer. Tested in PDI. 
Fix workaround post the workaround from problem to WorkNotes in open/in progress incidents and to the additional comments in resolved incidents and does not post anything on closed incidents.

Selected Answer: D
Question is about Open Incidents.
A) Resolved incidents are NOT open
Therefore correct answer is D

Selected Answer: D
From the book:
By default, the workaround gets copied to the Work notes of any active (not in a state of Resolved, Closed or Canceled) incident related to the problem record.
The workaround is also copied to the additional comments of any related incident that has a Resolution code of Known error.

comments.content:
This is very clearly given in CIS-ITSM (Tokyo) eBook page no. 355.
Workaround always gets copied to the Work Notes by default.
A is only applicable when incident is resolved with known error.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
D is correct because it is the default behavior. 
A is NOT correct because this is only applicable for resolved incidents, not for open incidents.

Selected Answer: D
From the book:
By default, the workaround gets copied to the Work notes of any active (not in a state of Resolved, Closed or Canceled) incident related to the problem record. 
The workaround is also copied to the additional comments of any related incident that has a Resolution code of Known error.

Selected Answer: D
Communicate Workaround calls two scripts:
1. Copy Prb workaround to work notes. Workaround is copied to Work notes for all incidents where State = New, In Progress, OR On Hold
2. Copy Pro workaround to Inc comments. Workaround is copied to Additional comments to all Resolved Incidents where Resolution code = Known error.
D only because comments when resolution code of incident is known error utah page 350

comments.content: it is only for resolved incidents which resolution code is 'known error'

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
When a user clicks on the "Communicate workaround" UI action on the Problem form, this typically triggers communication about the workaround for the problem to all related incidents.

Therefore, the most likely answer is A

Selected Answer: D
D is correct. See eBook p355. A is NOT correct - comment is populated only if State=Resolved AND Resolution Code=Known Error.
ebook Utah p. 350

Selected Answer: D
D is correct, p 355

Selected Answer: D
D for sure.

Selected Answer: D
D is correct. Tested in PDI.
D nha bro

Selected Answer: D
Answer is D.

Question is about Communicate WORKAROUND, not fix. Creates event "communicate.workaround", which has two script actions - "Copy Prb workaround to Inc work notes" and "Copy Prb workaround to Inc comments".

RESOLVED incidents is comment, otherwise it's work note.

Selected Answer: D
D is correct

Selected Answer: D
Logically D makes sense as well, since its a workaround which the Agent can decide whether how to take the information.

Selected Answer: D
checked on the book, tokyo version

https://docs.servicenow.com/bundle/utah-it-service-management/page/product/problem-management/concept/sync-btwn-inci-prob.html
Answer D
The workaround is copied to the Work notes field.

Selected Answer: D
D Please refer to the page 355 , Work around is only copied to comments if case incident already resolved\closed with resolution code know error

Selected Answer: D
D is correct base on cis itsm manual

Correct answer is D. The communicate workaround is not the comunicate fix as stated on other comments on this thread. The communicate workaround calls the copy prb workaround to work notes if incident is new\inprogress\on hold, Work around is only copied to comments if case already resolved\closed with resolution code know error
Both A and D are correct answer.

comments.content: Communicate Fix UI action calls the script action:Copy Prb fix to Inc comments"

Question is about Communicate WORKAROUND, not fix. Creates event "communicate.workaround".
RESOLVED is comment, otherwise it's work note.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
A Communicate Fix UI action calls the script action:Copy Prb fix to Inc comments"

Selected Answer: D
D is correct

Selected Answer: A
It is A according to the book. "Communicate Fix UI action calls the script action:Copy Prb fix to Inc comments"
This question is worded poorly. If this is pre san diego its A. If this is post san diego is both A and D.

Selected Answer: D
The workaround is copied to the Work notes field. A notification is sent to the users listed in the Assigned to and Work notes list fields. The notification is sent only when the incident state is New, On Hold, or In Progress.

Selected Answer: D
Correct Answer : D

Selected Answer: CD
C. The tester is impersonating a user with the "problem_coordinator" role: The "Communicate Fix" link is also visible to users with the "problem_coordinator" role. Therefore, the tester should also confirm if they can see the link by impersonating a user with this role.

D. The Fix notes field is filled in and saved: The "Communicate Fix" link appears only when the "Fix notes" field on the Problem record is filled in and saved. The tester needs to ensure that this field has been populated and saved before checking if the link is visible or not.

Selected Answer: CD
From the book:
The Communicate Fix UI action will not appear until text is saved to the Fix notes field. 
Also its best to make sure the user you impersonate has the role required.

Selected Answer: CD
The scenario in B is restrictive - Assignee _could_ be a problem_coordinator, but the more general scenario in C is broader and is also true. C and D are the best answers.

Selected Answer: CD
CD are correct, p 356

Selected Answer: CD
C and D are correct.

Selected Answer: CD
Answer is CD
C is actually correct just tried it on the lab instance, any user with the probelm_coordinator role is able to see that link.

Selected Answer: BD
correct

questions.question_text:
A tester wants to submit a bug report, because they are not able to see the Communicate Fix link under the Related Links on the Problem form.
What do you recommend that they confirm, before submitting the bug report? (Choose two.)

choices.C: Tester is impersonating a user with problem_coordinator role
choices.A: Tester is impersonating a user with communications.manager role
choices.B: Tester is impersonating the assignee, which has the problem_coordinator role
choices.D: The Fix notes field is filled in and saved

questions.question_text: Problem and Problem Task records, move automatically from New to Assess states, when which fields are filled? (Choose two.)

comments.content: It is actually BC (state and assigned to) pg.337

discussion.content:
The correct answer is: AC.
State is not a field which can be filled in, it always contain a value and is not selected by user.
CI is not used to move Problem to Asses, just try by creating a Problem with Short Description (which is mandatory by default) and CI, Problem will stay in New

Selected Answer: AC
The state field doesn't make sense

comments.content: I agree it does not make sense, even after testing it out.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: BC
Question is tricky, but page 337 in the guide confirms it with no mention of the Short Description field.

The Correct Answer is B and C. Although it does not make sense. However, it is configured in that way that system checks for State and Assigned to values. The configuration is in System UI > Form Sections > Assess Dialog Form view.

Selected Answer: BC
eBook Vancouver page 337

Selected Answer: AC
Why do you select state? State is pre-filled, c'mon. It is A and C.

Selected Answer: AC
AC CORRECT

Selected Answer: AC
Just now tried in PDI, as soon as we enter the short description and assigned to and save the form, the problem moves to Assess state automatically.

Selected Answer: BC
IT Service Management (ITSM) Implementation On Demand 
Module: 6.3 Problem Lifecycle Configuration
Page: Automatically move to the Assess State

Answer is BC

Selected Answer: BC
By default, State and Assigned to are required.

Selected Answer: BC
By default, State and assigned to are required! I wonder why did I paid for contributor access so that I spend more time checking every answer? Anybody got an answer to that?

BC.
Source page on read.inkling: Automatically move to the Assess state
AC is the correct answer

Selected Answer: BC
eBook pg 337

Selected Answer: BC
B,C, tokio pag 353
AD - Short description and a CI are both needed to accomplish this

Selected Answer: CD
The question is not which fields are mandatory, it's which fields when chosen change the status to Assess, and it's CD. Create a problem without a configuration item or Assigned to, then add them and save the record. You will see that it automatically goes to Assess.

Selected Answer: BC
Although it can be changed via the Assess Dialog Form View, by default state and assigned to are required. Pg 337
I scripted a record with empty state and empty short_description and it moved to assess.

UTAH Release:
By default state and assigned to are required. Pg. 337

Selected Answer: BC
Business rule "Update Problem State to Assess" changes state to "Assess" when fields "State" and "Assigned to" on "assess_dialog_form_view" are provided.

Selected Answer: AC
We have this demo in video through the CIS ITSM On Demand path

discussion.content:

Update Problem State to Asses business rule checks if the fields in the Assess Dialog Form View dialog are filled. By default, State and Assigned to are required.

Selected Answer: AC
Short description and Assign to are two mandatory fields on the PRB Form when creating a new PRB record.
State is the read-only field on the PRB form

Selected Answer: AC
In case of Problem task record Short description and Assigned to fields are mandatory for moving the state from New to Assess. You can check this on your instance on a Problem task record.

comments.content: State field is a read only field, we can't select it manually.

Per pg 353 in the CIS-ITSM ebook, "Problem records and problem task records in the New state automatically to Assess when the required values (fields) are provided." "By default, State and Assigned to are required."

questions.question_text: Which of the following are defined for a given change model? (Choose three.)

discussion.content:

IT Service Management (ITSM) Implementation On Demand
Module 7.2 - Change and Release Management
Page: Multimodal change (Change models)

Answer - BCE
BCE are the correct three. It's state related

An individual change model will have the following defined:
- State models
- State transitions
- State transition conditions
ebook pages 392-394

questions.question_text: On a Change Approval Definition record, what does the ‘wait for’ condition define?

choices.B: The state the change must be in before the approval notifications can be sent
choices.D: The fields that must be populated before the approval can be requested
choices.C: The number or percentage of users from the approval group that must approve the change
choices.A: Whether the change approval is sent to an individual user or a group
